*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Emily M. Perry, August 21, 1826. Conditions in the colony—Indians, crops, slavery, biographical.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="08-21-1826"> Augt. 21, 1826*/date_mentioned* */p**p*Dr *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*I embrace the opportunity by *person_mentioned*Col. Matson*/person_mentioned* to drop you a line, he has promised to stay one night at *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned*s*/location_mentioned* and as he has seen a good deal of this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*he can give you information relative to it— *person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*has taken a trip into the *location_mentioned*interior */location_mentioned*about six hundred miles and I do not expect him back before *date_mentioned n="01-xx-1827">January*/date_mentioned*, he started *date_mentioned n="08-01-1826">three weeks ago*/date_mentioned* and I have heard from him once, he was well—the affairs of the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*are going on tolorably well tho imigration is not very rapid we have had some difficulties with the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*which no doubt are very much magnified *location_mentioned*abroad*/location_mentioned*, they are not serious and I think will soon terminate, the *person_mentioned*tribe */person_mentioned*that troubles us is not over 200 strong and their depredations are confined to stealing horses, you need not be at all uneasy about any reports you hear on this subject—we have had some sickness owing to an unusual wet season, tho but few deaths and those confined to new comers—*/p*
*p*The constitution of this *location_mentioned*State */location_mentioned*will be finished shortly and when I see it I can give *person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned* more certain advice as to the prospect of a removal here, and untill then I do not wish him to derange his business where he is by making any preparations for a removal—*/p*
*p*I have heard by report that the suit between *person_mentioned*Price*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Sam1 Perry*/person_mentioned* has been decided in favor of *person_mentioned*Perry*/person_mentioned*—if so does it not fully decide the principle that the whole *location_mentioned*Estate */location_mentioned*can be recovered? I have not heard from you since the *date_mentioned n="01-08-1826">8 of January*/date_mentioned* and feel very anxious to know the particulars—My prospects of making a fortune here are bad, I shall be but poorly compensated tho. expect to pay my debts and make a comfortable support for my old age—If *person_mentioned*brother */person_mentioned*succeeds in procuring Stock as he expects and which is the object of his journey I shall settle down on a stock farm and perhaps follow the example of *person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned* and hunt a jolly old *person_mentioned*widow*/person_mentioned* to comfort me in my old age—The truth is that both *person_mentioned*brother */person_mentioned*and myself are too much unsettled as yet to trammel ourselves with a *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*, or one of us would no doubt have been married before this—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr Andrews*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*and the *person_mentioned*Allys */person_mentioned*are all well and appear very well contented—I think it probable that slavery will not be allowed in this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, tho the constitution will decide it, and as soon as I know the result I will write you*/p*—
*p*We have most extraordinary crops this year corn is plenty at 25 cents, pork and Beef is also cheap and abundant, our cotton is of a superior quality and produces very well the average highth of cotton on the *location_mentioned*bottom lands*/location_mentioned* is from 9 to 12 feet and yields generally 2500 to 3000 pounds to the acre*/p*
*p*We are begining to have some little trade with *location_mentioned*Orleans*/location_mentioned*, tho not much as yet.*/p*
*p*Kiss all the *person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*for me and be sure and make *person_mentioned*business men*/person_mentioned* of them, learn them some occupation or profession that will support them through life—I am not in a situation to take any of them yet, and it is rather uncertain when I shall be*/p*
*p*I have nothing very particular to write as you perceive—your letters must have miscarried for I have not heard from you since *date_mentioned n="01-xx-1826">Jany*/date_mentioned* except by report of *person_mentioned*travellers */person_mentioned*which informed me of your health—*/p*
*p*Remember me to my old *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*Mrs John Perry*/person_mentioned* and her *person_mentioned*husband*/person_mentioned* and all the *person_mentioned*Perrys */person_mentioned*and all other *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*and write oftener— your *person_mentioned*brother*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mrs. Emily M. Perry*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Mine á Burton Washington County Missouri*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Col. Matson*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
